title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 183.6 - Termination of appointment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 183.6 - Termination of appointment

State Regulations
(a) The
commissioner or his designee may terminate the appointment of a license issuing
officer or the appointment of an assistant license issuing officer at any time, for any of the following reasons, and may in his discretion afford an
opportunity for a hearing with respect thereto: (1)
the annual license sales at a place of
business are less than 100, as specified in section
183.2
(e) of this

Part; (2)
ownership of the place of
business has changed; (3)
the
license issuing officer or assistant license issuing officer for whom he is
responsible has violated any of the requirements relative to the performance of
duty as provided by section
183.5
of this Part, as
appropriate; (4)
the officer has
ceased to meet the eligibility requirements for appointment as set forth in
section 183.2 or
183.3
of this Part, as
appropriate. (b) In
cases where a termination procedure is instituted because of alleged fiscal or
bookkeeping improprieties, the department shall hold such hearing within 10
days of its removing unsold licenses from the place of business and the
completion of a fiscal audit. Notice of such hearing shall be given by the
department at the time it removes such licenses. (c) In cases where a termination procedure is
instituted for reasons other than fiscal or bookkeeping improprieties, the
department shall hold such hearing upon not less than 20 days advance written
notice to such officer. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
183.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
